image.altText: Two teens in balaclavas flank another teen carrying a weight.

props.synopsis: A taxpayer-funded mentoring program for at-risk Tasmanian youths posted footage on social media showing workers at a camp dressed in black clothes and balaclavas.

title.children: 'Wrong kind of message': Workers at camp for at-risk youth dressed in balaclavas

image.altText: A digital rendering of the inside of a stadium.

props.synopsis: Cricket Tasmania and the Macquarie Point stadium proponent believe they have found the solution to concerns about how the stadium's roof could affect cricket.

title.children: Concerns about proposed stadium roof solved, Cricket Tasmania says

image.altText: Six puppy labradoodles in a cage

props.synopsis: A position paper sets out limits for breeders and proposes an information sharing system for better regulation.

title.children: Tasmania's dog welfare overhaul to help stamp out puppy farms

image.altText: Sam Pang looks slightly pained as he poses in a suit with a sticker reading "yes football team yes stadium".

props.synopsis: Comedian Sam Pang will star in new comedy Ground Up as Hugh Shen, an AFL administrator sent from Melbourne to Tasmania to create a new club. It's one of a host of new shows coming to the ABC in 2026.

title.children: Sam Pang to star in new comedy about Tasmanian AFL club, stadium

image.altText: the front gate of mine with the sign SIMEC

props.synopsis: A restriction on Tahmoor Coal's licence will not be removed until $29.4 million in outstanding royalties are paid to the NSW government.

title.children: NSW tells Gupta we’re not giving you any special treatment, pay your debts first

image.altText: Pink sand in a dish with a spoon.

props.synopsis: Thirteen public schools will remain closed on Thursday, and another 22 will remain partially closed. Several non-government schools are also closed or partially closed as education authorities respond to the recall of coloured sand products found to contain traces of asbestos.

title.children: When will Tasmanian schools affected by the coloured sand recall reopen?

image.altText: Composite image of Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett.

props.synopsis: Australia is set to blood two debutants in a Test for the first time since 2019 as the Ashes get underway in Perth on Friday.

title.children: Tasmanian Jake Weatherald set to be named for Australia in first Ashes Test

image.altText: A track map from the BOM that shows Cyclone Fina making landfall near Minjilang.

props.synopsis: Darwin is officially on cyclone watch, with Tropical Cyclone Fina now forecast to pass between the Northern Territory capital and the Tiwi Islands on Saturday.

title.children: Latest cyclone track map shows Fina tracking closer to Darwin

image.altText: Nvidia logo and rising stock graph are seen in this illustration

props.synopsis: The ASX is surging higher today, but Japan's bond market is being sold off, pushing some interest rates to their highest level since the global financial crisis. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX surges but Japanese bonds flash red

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Afternoon update of ASX movers and shakers

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Police compiled the CCTV and traffic camera vision by tracking a car registered to Rajwinder Singh before Toyah Cordingley was allegedly murdered.

title.children: CCTV of accused before alleged Toyah Cordingley murder played to jury

image.altText: Nathan McKeown Arnie the German shepherd

props.synopsis: Queensland Police had been investigating the alleged theft of a vehicle and Arnie the German shepherd, from Brisbane's bayside.

title.children: Owner charged over allegedly abandoning dog Arnie after claiming he was stolen

image.altText: Jace Austin, father of Ben Austin kisses a rose on the coffin during his son's funeral.

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Junction Oval was a sea of cricket shirts, football jumpers and scarves as friends and family gathered to farewell beloved teenager Ben Austin, who died in a tragic cricket accident last month.

title.children: 'Champion young man' who died in cricketing accident farewelled

image.altText: A curly-haired man cleans a window.

props.synopsis: A multinational company is taking a small-town Australian cleaner to court, claiming his glass-cleaning product is deceptively similar to its own.

title.children: Multinational company sues small-town cleaner over packaging

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: A photo of defective plumbing work in a backyard, with piles of dirt and broken concrete

props.synopsis: Home owners are demanding action after years trying to access insurance payouts for failed plumbing work that has left properties a mess and, in some cases, unliveable.

title.children: Home owners filthy on plumbing industry as insurance firms dig in

image.altText: The family of killed teen Ethan Hoac hold his photo outside the Supreme Court of Victoria

props.synopsis: The killer of Ethan Hoac — who was murdered in an unprovoked attack in Melbourne's north-west in 2023 — is sentenced to more than a decade behind bars for a crime labelled "appalling" and "vicious".

title.children: Judge says horror of 14-year-old boy's murder 'hard to comprehend'

image.altText: Richard, left, and Janette, right, stand together and pose for a formal image in their modern home featuring indoor garden.

props.synopsis: Only someone whose family has long lived next to a river famous for catastrophic flooding would dare to build on this block. Here's what we can all learn from Richard and Janette's new home.

title.children: What we can learn from this $2m new-build on a flood-prone block

image.altText: Shepparton car thief leaves baby in a box

props.synopsis: Police search for a man who stole a car with a sleeping baby in the back seat from a supermarket car park in northern Victoria, before dumping the child in a box and driving away.

title.children: Hunt continues for man who stole car with baby inside and dumped him in box

image.altText: A child drinks water from a bubbler.

props.synopsis: Large studies conclude there is no evidence to back up community concerns that fluoride in water at recommended levels may affect the cognition or IQ of children.

title.children: Is fluoride in water toxic? Here's what decades of research tells us

image.altText: A woman's left hand strikes lettered keys on a computer keyboard with fingers that have painted fingernails.

props.synopsis: Australia's mining and manufacturing sectors are taking up to two years to notice and report cyber breaches to authorities, prompting concerns about the data security of industries critical to the nation's economy.

title.children: Data of up to 3.6m people exposed in cyber breaches, FOI shows

image.altText: A black and white photo of a naval vessel at sea, taken from a bird's eye perspective.

props.synopsis: The Russian vessel had directed lasers at pilots of surveillance aircraft monitoring its activities.

title.children: 'We see you': UK warns Russia as spy ship nears British waters

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: The prime minister, when in opposition, accused the Coalition of "hollowing out" the CSIRO. Now, following the announcement 350 research positions at the organisation will be cut, he is being accused of being "worse than Abbott".

title.children: Government playing down impact of CSIRO job cuts

image.altText: A serious-looking man in a grey jumper speaks at a podium.

props.synopsis: The head of one of Australia's most powerful unions has suffered a vote of no confidence amid claims he was aware of allegedly improper use of members' resources to raise money from bosses for an election slush fund.

title.children: UWU boss accused of 'misleading' members about slush fund links

image.altText: comet 31 atlas, a yellow looking orb moves through the solar system, the image is grainy

props.synopsis: Discovered in July this year, the comet known as 3I/Atlas is only the third confirmed object to visit our corner of the cosmos from another star.

title.children: NASA unveils close-up pictures of Comet 3I/Atlas in our solar system

image.altText: Four containers with coloured sand inside.

props.synopsis: A regional NSW after-school hours operator says an asbestos removal company wanted to charge her more than $14,000 to vacuum up a small amount of coloured sand that spilled onto a carpet.

title.children: Care provider quoted $14k to remove a 'few clumps' of coloured sand

image.altText: Three young people standing in a courtyard with serious looks on their faces holding a protest sign

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong is considering redundancies at a well-regarded support service for victim-survivors of sexual assault.

title.children: Uni students furious at 'shameful' plans to cut support service staff

image.altText: Serious Ned has a red band around his forehead, grey beard and moustache, wears an Indigenous-print shirt, background blurred.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi White investigation continues six months on from his death as the Department of Public Prosecutions awaits "the provision of further material" from NT Police. But the family says the findings are taking too long.

title.children: Death in custody ruling delayed as DPP requests details from NT Police

image.altText: An exterior image of Somerville House girls' boarding school,  red brick in 1920s building with girls walking in front.

props.synopsis: One of Brisbane's most prestigious all-girls schools is in crisis mode after students were able to access a document where teachers wrote notes about students' appearances, personalities and their parents.

title.children: Brisbane girls school under fire after teachers' dossier on students leaked

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren walks in the paddock, with cameras on him

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri enters the third-last grand prix of the season further away from the drivers' championship lead than he has been all year.

title.children: How to follow Oscar Piastri during the F1 grand prix in Las Vegas

image.altText: A crowd of onlookers - mostly couples in their 30s - wearing puffer jackets and holding umbrellas along a residential street.

props.synopsis: Real estate agents in Victoria will be required to publish a property's reserve price at least seven days before it goes to auction, under new laws the state government says will stamp out illegal underquoting.

title.children: Reserve property prices to be published in underquoting crackdown

image.altText: A man, blurred, is escorted away by police in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Four people have been arrested at Bega on the NSW South Coast following the fatal stabbing of a 43-year-old man last month.

title.children: Four people arrested six weeks after fatal stabbing on NSW South Coast

image.altText: A blonde woman in a pink dress looks at a woman with green skin who wears a witch's hat and holds a broomstick.

props.synopsis: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo shine in Wicked: For Good, but does the sequel live up to the thrill of its predecessor?

title.children: Wicked: For Good saved by the magnetic performances of its stars
